item.description: Data sharing Sharing of accounts login information (like passwords or SSH keys) is stricty forbidden on Grex, as well as on most of the HPC systems. There is a mechanism of data/file sharing that does not require sharing of the accounts. To access each others' data on Grex, the UNIX groups and permissions mechanism can be used as explined below. We use a Westgrid exlpanation because Grex is still using Westgrid accounts and groups database, so the text below is still relevant.

Data sizes and quotas This section explains how to find the actual use of your /home/ and /global/scratch allocations on Grex. We limit the size of the data and the number of files that can be stored on these filesystem. To figure out where your current usage stands with the limit, POSIX quota or Lustres' analog, lfs quota commands can be used. NFS quota The _/home/ filesystem is served by NFSv1 and thus supports the standard POSIX quota command.
